message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses a new approach to managing a shared ledger that is secure and decentralized, making it relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. The use of cryptography and the focus on generating a transaction history that does not fork suggests that cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the efficiency of the approach, which could make it relevant to cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper's focus on constructing a block of valid transactions suggests that it could also be relevant to cs.CC (Computational Complexity) and the use of verifiers suggests that it could be relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
